name: 3,3'-benzene-1,3-diylbisprop-2-ynoic acid
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3247
Reason: Basic unit, benzene has a melting point around 5.5 degrees Celsius. The presence of two carboxylic acid groups significantly increases the melting point due to their ability to form strong intermolecular hydrogen bonding; each carboxylic acid group can be expected to raise the melting point by approximately 40 to 50 degrees Celsius. Additionally, the two alkyne groups in the structure contribute to an increased melting point by introducing rigidity and linearity to the molecule. Each alkyne group could be expected to raise the melting point by about 10 degrees Celsius. Thus, the cumulative effect of the functional groups should be considered.
Test (Predicted reason):
The compound in question is a derivative of benzene with two prop-2-ynoic acid groups. The basic unit, benzene, has a melting point of 5.5°C. The prop-2-ynoic acid groups are capable of forming strong hydrogen bonds, which significantly increases the melting point. Each prop-2-ynoic acid group is estimated to contribute +100°C to the melting point due to the strong hydrogen bonding and the rigidity it introduces to the molecule. The presence of two such groups will further increase the melting point.
